body_content.explanation: a large, deciduous forest tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn and grows new ones in the spring) that grows in central and eastern parts of North America:
examples: There are concerns that the numbers of white ash trees in the North could significantly decline.
The varieties of ash native to America, such as the white ash, die within about three years of infestation.

body_content.explanation: the wood of the white ash tree, used especially to make baseball bats (= sticks to hit the ball with):
examples: The company makes bats only out of northern white ash and hard rock maple.
Most major league baseball players hit with bats made of white ash.
